org.jclouds.abiquo.domain.infrastructure
Class StoragePool

java.lang.Object
  org.jclouds.abiquo.domain.DomainWrapper<com.abiquo.server.core.infrastructure.storage.StoragePoolDto>
      org.jclouds.abiquo.domain.infrastructure.StoragePool

public class StoragePool
extends DomainWrapper<com.abiquo.server.core.infrastructure.storage.StoragePoolDto>

Adds high level functionality to StoragePoolDto. The Storage Pool Resource allows you to perform any administrative task for remote pools.

Author:
Ignasi Barrera, Francesc Montserrat
See Also:
http://community.abiquo.com/display/ABI20/StoragePoolResource

Method Detail

delete

public void delete()
Delete the storage pool.

See Also:
http://community.abiquo.com/display/ABI20/StoragePoolResource#StoragePoolResource- Deleteastoragepool

save

public void save()
Create a storage pool. Create a storage pool means registering an existing storage pool obtained from StorageDevice.listRemoteStoragePools() method and saving it. The Storage Pools must be associated with a Tier using setTier(org.jclouds.abiquo.domain.infrastructure.Tier).

See Also:
http://community.abiquo.com/display/ABI20/StoragePoolResource#StoragePoolResource- Createastoragepoolwithatierlink

update

public void update()
Update pool information in the server with the data from this pool. Storage pool parameters cannot be updated by a user, so the parameters are only a representation of the remote pool. Although the whole storage pool entity is sent to the API in the update call, the only thing a user can change is the tier that the pool belongs to by calling setTier(org.jclouds.abiquo.domain.infrastructure.Tier).

See Also:
http://community.abiquo.com/display/ABI20/Storage+Pool+Resource#StoragePoolResource- UpdateaStoragePool

refresh

public void refresh()

setTier

public void setTier(Tier tier)
Define the tier in which the pool will be added.

See Also:
http://community.abiquo.com/display/ABI20/StoragePoolResource#StoragePoolResource- Createastoragepoolwithatierlink

getStorageDevice

public StorageDevice getStorageDevice()
Get the device where the pool belongs.

See Also:
http://community.abiquo.com/display/ABI20/StorageDeviceResource#StorageDeviceResource- Retrieveastoragedevice

getTier

public Tier getTier()
Get the tier assigned to the pool. The storage pool needs to be persisted in Abiquo first.

Returns:
The tier assinged to this storage pool.
